file_content.text: Mission to retrieve memory cores complete. Repairs for this unit progressing normally.
Droid. I have your Rakata memory cores.
Analyzing... scan complete. Data is intact. Rakata schematics, work orders and material lists are present.
Prison may be duplicated. Forwarding to Imperial Intelligence for review. Your assistance is appreciated.
The Rakata memory cores must be retrieved. This unit does not understand the delay.
Halt. This is a restricted area. Imperial sentients only. Scanning for potential threats.
Squad cannot be classified. Sentients do not appear hostile. Begin report.
My lord. Welcome to Maintenance Bay 772. This unit will report.
Sentient has received credits from Imperial accounts. Classification: mercenary.
Imperial officer, rank unknown. All units must report to superior officer present.
Designation: SD-9. Mission to retrieve Rakata memory cores failed. Design of Belsavis prison cannot be duplicated.
I don't accept failure, even from a droid.
I'm disappointed in you.
This unit regrets the flaws in its design. This unit believes its mission could still be completed.
The Rakata built more than cell blocks here.
This is no ordinary prison.
Error: Data is outside mission parameters. This unit is only concerned with Belsavis prison.
Everyone's escaping this place. I'd call that a failed design.
You want to copy this failure?
Security has failed due to warfare and severe decay. The Empire would improve the design.
Who authorized this? Where would this prison go?
Explain your mission.
Mission was originally authorized by: classified. Duplicate prison would be built at: classified.
Duplicated?
Belsavis prison is the most secure detention center in the galaxy. Its success can be duplicated.
I didn't ask for a report.
Error: This unit has been heavily damaged. This unit must report before related data is lost.
This unit was sent to obtain memory cores from Rakata units long deactivated. These units were used to construct this prison.
Information in said memory cores can be used to construct a duplicate prison, in the event the Empire cannot conquer Belsavis.
Why couldn't you get the memory cores?
But your mission failed.
The Empire? Lose?
The Empire? Lose?
The Empire is prepared to deal with all contingencies, no matter how unlikely.
So go try again.
This unit has been severely damaged. Other units would be equally vulnerable.
Several class-A battle droids accompanied this unit in the search. Said droids were destroyed by rioting Esh-kha prisoners.
Esh-kha continue to occupy suspected location of Rakata memory cores. Memory cores must be successfully retrieved.
Give me the location.
I'll waste some time.
The Esh-kha are strong, but disorganized. This unit is certain you will succeed.
Coordinates are provided. Return the memory cores to this unit's position for proper analysis.
Not my problem. [Refuse quest]
Error: The memory cores must be retrieved. This unit must report its failure.
Self-diagnostic in progress. Self-diagnostic complete. This unit is in need of maintenance.
